original_title: Six investors eyeing stake in Sri LankanAirlines: Minister
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Six investors have expressed interest in buying stakes in SriLankan Airlines, Minister of Ports, Shipping and Aviation Nimal Siripala De Silva said.

“A pre-bid meeting is held before, for the purpose of providing more information for the investors. In one such meeting, six investors have expressed their interest in buying stake,” De Silva said. “Since the investors are familiarising themselves with the information, they have submitted an Expression of Interest to extend the deadline, to the middle of January.”
He said that by May the government would be able to choose a suitable investor for the airline and turn it into a more resilient aviation service provider – and carry out the restructuring process.

“This is done in a very transparent manner,” he said, with the World Bank’s and International Monetary Fund’s involvement and technical assistance. “The World Bank has appointed a ‘Transaction Manager’ to oversee this process. Following this individual’s suggestions, a Sri Lankan team has been appointed, particularly from within the Treasury, and the restructuring process has begun,” he said.

He said the Prime Minister has appointed a technical team, with the involvement of the private sector, to analyse and present the benefits listed in the Expressions of Interests received. (Colombo/Dec11/2023)
